what: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
title: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
text: function calculates complete combinatorial supplied vectors using loop implementation taking difference every combination elements vectors. input vectors must numeric, can different lengths.

title: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
text: x, y Two numeric vectors representing independent empriical distributions compared

title: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
text: list following components: method name test statistic test statistic means means two input vectors

title: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
text: Poe G. L., Giraud, K. L. & Loomis, J. B., 2005, Computational methods measuring difference empirical distributions, American Journal Agricultural Economics, 87:353-365

title: Test for the difference in independent empirical distributions — poe_test
code: x <- qnorm(runif(100), mean = -0.5, sd = 1) y <- qnorm(runif(100), mean = 1.5, sd = 2) poe_test(x, y) #> Method:  Poe et al. (2005) test  #>  #> Means:  #>      x      y  #> -0.577  1.960  #>  #> H0: x = y  #> H1: x > y | x < y  #>  #> Gamma:  0.8631  #>  #> Gamma >.95 and <.05 indicates difference at the 5% level.

title: cmtools v0.0.1
text: Added functions calculate sandwich estimator covariance matrix model solved using BGW. Added function add scores BGW object Added broom generics BGW objects Added function Poe et al. (2005) test
